meanings.definition: To fall or flow in a sequence of stages.
meanings.sent1: The colorful leaves cascaded down from the tree.
meanings.sent2: Water cascaded down the waterfall, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn cascaded out of the bag, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cascaded through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The confetti cascaded from the ceiling, adding to the festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To arrange (a number of devices or objects) in a series or sequence.
meanings.sent1: She cascaded the books on the shelf according to their size.
meanings.sent2: The lights cascaded along the street, illuminating the path.
meanings.sent3: He cascaded the toys on the floor, creating a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: The flowers cascaded in a beautiful pattern in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The dominoes cascaded one after another, creating a chain reaction.
